id: T1 Sycamore (Acer Psuedoplatanus) - Dismantle and remove. Although the tree is currently in generally good physiological condition, there is a significant cavity located approximately halfway up the main stem. The cavity extends to around halfway into the heartwood and has previously supported two large fruiting bodies of Dryads Saddle (Cerioporus squamosus). This species is a wood-decay fungus associated with white rot. While it is considered a secondary decay organism, once established it can significantly accelerate structural weakening of the host timber.
addr: 4 River View Boston Spa Wetherby LS23 6BA

id: Single storey side/rear extension and replacement windows
addr: 6 Chestnut End Boston Spa Wetherby LS23 6JG

id: T1 Holm Oak (Tag No.1735) labelled as T45 - Proposed work is to fell the tree and have the stump ground out. This work is deemed urgent due to advanced decay and poses an unacceptable level of risk. A Holm Oak will be replanted in an adjacent location. T2 Sycamore (Tag No.1646) labelled as T1 - This tree is to be felled and have the stump ground out. The tree is directly adjacent to the main vehicular/pedestrian entrance to the estate and a single-story neighbouring property. It has extensive dieback and squirrel damage to the crown. It has previously had crown cleaning and retrenchment work undertaken to allow us to monitor the decline and manage the risks. It regularly loses branches. This work is pre-emptive against growing risk. A Quercus x bimundorum 'Crimson Oak' will be replanted in an adjacent location. T3 Scots Pine (Tag No. 1852) labelled as T182 - Proposed work is to fell the tree. This struggling, leaning and misshapen tree compromises the growth of an adjacent Pine. A Ginkgo Biloba 'Fastigiata Blagon' is to be planted in an adjacent, more open position.
addr: Bayford And Company Ltd Bowcliffe Hall Paradise Way Bramham Wetherby LS23 6LP

id: T1 Sycamore - This tree has grown as 2 trunks from the base and has a hollow in the trunk low down, which is causing concern to the owner of the tree. Therefore I'm asking for permission to give this tree a 5m reduction in height, to take considerable amount of weight out of the tree to lessen the chance of failure. T2 Sycamore closest to tree one and aver the class building in the pictures - Reduce 2m in height, owner is concerned about the height due to neighbouring houses. T3 Sycamore behind T-2 on pictures and on very boundary of neighbouring property - Reduce height by up to 2m to reduce risk of catching wind and snapping branches. Concerned about the close proximity to neighbouring houses. T4 Sycamore tree on the right of the picture with 2 standing together - Reduce in height by up to 2m and thin upper canopy by 10 percent. Close proximity of this tree to neighbouring property. T5 Sycamore on the left hand side of the same picture as T4 - Reduce in height by up to 2m and thin upper canopy by 10 percent. Close proximity to neighbouring property.
addr: The Old Hall Back Lane Bramham Wetherby LS23 6QR

id: Copper Beech: The proposed works comprise light crown pruning as part of routine maintenance. This will involve selectively reducing and tidying the outer canopy to manage its overall spread, improve the trees form, and prevent further encroachment beyond the garden boundary. The intention is to retain the trees amenity value while ensuring it remains appropriately proportioned for its setting. In addition, the upper branches are now growing close to the nearby telephone line (see photos). Undertaking modest crown reduction at this stage will prevent potential interference with the service infrastructure and avoid the need for more extensive works in the future. The proposed pruning is therefore both preventative and proportionate, supporting the long-term health of the tree while addressing emerging practical concerns.
addr: 3 Belle Vue Terrace Albion Street Clifford Wetherby LS23 6JA
